intro: Digitalis minor var. minima, commonly known as the Lesser Foxglove, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in woodland or shaded areas with moist, well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
